poem:
### Doubt Cast in Iron

In doubt,  
the cold sea cradles  
submarines rust-touched  
in the weight of time  
and treaties.  
  
Beneath whispers of alliances,  
a muted echo:  
  
Can steel hold trust  
when nations drift,  
and oceans widen,  
as shadows lengthen  
over breaking waves?  

A costly dawn,  
uncertain,   
unwritten.
